intro: Epilobium philippinense, commonly known as Philippine willow. It is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, belonging to the family Onagraceae. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It produces small, pink to purple flowers clustered in racemes, which bloom during the warmer months. Epilobium philippinense is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
